title: 3 Easy Ways to Reopen Snapchat Pictures, Videos, and Story

steps.title: Open a Snap.
steps.content: Open a Snap. This will play the Snap normally. Replay Again is only available if you have a subscription to Snapchat+ . In addition to replaying Snaps twice, you can also customize your app icon, get chat wallpapers, custom notification sounds , and more. [1] X Research source Similar to replaying Snaps normally, Replay Again will send a notification to the other user that you have replayed the Snap.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap again.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap again. This will reload the Snap.

steps.title: Tap the Snap to view it.
steps.content: Tap the Snap to view it. The Snap will replay for the first time. Be sure not to leave the Chat screen.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap again.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap again. This will reload the Snap.

steps.title: Tap the Snap to view it again.
steps.content: Tap the Snap to view it again. This will replay the Snap for a second time. If you leave the chat screen before replaying the Snap, you won't be able to replay it again. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap an unopened Snap on the Chat screen.
steps.content: Tap an unopened Snap on the Chat screen. This displays the Snap for the first time.

steps.title: Stay on the "Chat" screen.
steps.content: Stay on the "Chat" screen. If you quit the app or switch to another page like your profile or the camera screen, you'll lose the opportunity to replay this Snap.

steps.title: Tap and hold the friend who sent you the Snap.
steps.content: Tap and hold the friend who sent you the Snap. The snap will be marked as "New" and allow you to view it again. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Snap to replay it.
steps.content: Tap the Snap to replay it. You can only replay each Snap you receive once unless you have Snapchat+.

steps.title: Swipe left on the camera screen.
steps.content: Swipe left on the camera screen. This will switch you to the "Stories" screen. You can also tap the two-person icon to navigate there. When you replay a Snap, the user will be notified by Snapchat.

steps.title: Tap a friend's story to view it.
steps.content: Tap a friend's story to view it. You can see all your friends' stories under the Friends header at the top. Tapping a story will play it for the first time. After you view a story, your friend's icon at the top of the Stories screen will turn into a black-and-white rounded arrow.

steps.title: Tap the round arrow icon on your friend's story.
steps.content: Tap the round arrow icon on your friend's story. This replays your friend's story. You can replay story Snaps as many times as you want until they expire. Your friend will see that you've watched their Story, but they won't know how many times. If your friend has Snapchat+ and has Story Rewatch Count enabled, they can see that you rewatched the Story at least once, but they won't see the total number of times. [4] X Research source

steps.title: There's no guaranteed way to rewatch Snaps without them knowing.
steps.content: There's no guaranteed way to rewatch Snaps without them knowing. When you first replay a Snap, Snapchat will send a notification to the user that you rewatched it. Other methods, such as using Airplane Mode before you open it, are not guaranteed to work. You can try saving the pictures without notifying before the first watch expires. This may include taking a screenshot on another device.
